intro: Saxifraga oppositifolia subsp. ajanica, commonly known as the Arctic sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, or purple. The plant has a rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas. Saxifraga oppositifolia subsp. ajanica is well adapted to cold climates and can survive in low-light conditions.
